docs.title: What is it?
docs.text: thecrbox is ready to use, drop-in hardware platform which converts a regular CR box to a smart air purifier

docs.title: Status
docs.text:
We're currently in the process of releasing diagrams and basic firmware for thecrbox.

A small test-batch of pre-assembled devices is currently ready to be shipped, and will be made available as soon as WiFi-provisioning and OTA will be tested.

docs.title: Wi-Fi provisioning
docs.text:
thercbox is in Wi-Fi provisioning mode (expecting to join your home network) when it's delivered or after factory reset

If you don't need Wi-Fi, you can [force your device into offline mode][ui-offlinemode] instead of provisioning it.

docs.title: Provisioning methods
docs.text:
Instructions are slightly different depending on a device you currently use. Please pick:

  • Android
  • iPhone
  • PC with Wi-Fi
  • laptop with Bluetooth and Chrome browser

tip: if you have multiple devices available, use Android as it's easiest.

docs.title: Welcome!
docs.text: You're here because you're setting up your thecrbox. Great!

docs.title: Why?
docs.text:
To access all features (e.g. fine-tune the PID if needed), thecrbox must be accessible via Wi-Fi network you plan to control it with. There’s no dedicated Android/iOS app -- you’ll enter your Wi-Fi details during setup.

If you don't need Wi-Fi, you can [force your device into offline mode][ui-offlinemode] instead of provisioning it.

docs.title: Can it go wrong?
docs.text:
Wi-Fi names and passwords are case-sensitive.

In case you entered wrong credentials and thecrbox does not join your network, you can always [force factory reset][factoryreset] and try again.

docs.title: Provisioning methods
docs.text:
Instructions are slightly different depending on a device you currently use. Please pick:

  • Android
  • iPhone
  • PC with Wi-Fi
  • laptop with Bluetooth and Chrome browser

tip: if you have multiple devices available, use Android as it's easiest.

docs.title: Android (Improv over BLE)
docs.text:
Your browser doesn’t support Web Bluetooth. Use Chrome/Edge on desktop or Android.

  1. Tap the button above^
  2. Find box2-XXXX from the nearby deviceslist
  3. Click "Pair" (approve the pairing/permission prompt)
  4. Enter your Wi-Fi name and password, then tap OK

docs.title: Provisioning footer
docs.text: Your device should now be ready. See how to use [use web server][ui-webserver] or [connect to HomeAssistant][ui-homeassistant]

docs.title: iPhone, computer or Android (manual via hotspot)
docs.text:
1. In Wi-Fi settings, join the box2-XXXX network (this network has no internet; it’s only for setup)
  2. In Safari, open open: http://192.168.4.1 (note: http://, not https://)
  3. Enter your Wi-Fi name and password, then tap Save

Hotspot will be shut down, and your phone should re-connect with your home wifi.

docs.title: Provisioning with laptop with Bluetooth and Chrome
Laptop with with Bluetooth and Chrome browser (Improv over BLE)
docs.text:
Your browser doesn’t support Web Bluetooth. Use Chrome/Edge on desktop or Android.

  1. Tap the button above^
  2. Find box2-XXXX from the nearby deviceslist
  3. Click "Pair" (approve the pairing/permission prompt)
  4. Enter your Wi-Fi name and password, then tap OK

docs.title: PC or any device with WiFi (manual via hotspot)
docs.text:
1. In Wi-Fi settings, join the box2-XXXX network (this network has no internet; it’s only for setup)
  2. In any browser, open open: http://192.168.4.1 (note: http://, not https://)
  3. Enter your Wi-Fi name and password, then tap Save

Hotspot will be shut down, and your PC should re-connect with your home wifi.

docs.title: Factory reset
docs.text:
• press the encoder button for 4-10 seconds

This will reset all non-default settings of thecrbox. This may be useful when wrong Wi-Fi credentials were supplied during initial device configuration, and your device is not able to join your network
